resources.string: Google Now provides no third-party API. Instead Commandr has to listen to Google Now via an accessiblity service. This service will only give Commandr the ability to listen to text entered into Google Now and this information is not stored. If you are not comfortable with this, you may also use a limited version of Commandr which requires you to say \"Note to Self\" before every command.
In System Settings, please enable Commandr\'s accessibility service. DO NOT accidentally enable Talkback
To take a normal note, just start with \"note\"
For some devices, this dialog does not function properly and must be configured later within Google Now
To use a command you need to first say \"note to self\"
Example: \"Note to self turn on flashlight\"
Type the command for \"Pause Music\" below:
Google Now has no third-party support. Instead Commandr has to listen to the \"Note to Self\" Interface
In the dialog, please select Commandr for Google Now as the default (Select Always)
This accessibility service will allow Commandr to listen to any text entered in Google Now. Commandr will not store any information and will only perform an action for a preconfigured command.
